page.title: 06ST. MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content: St. Michael's Church stands apart from the modern village of Sunninghill at the end of a leafy lane.There has been a church here for over a thousand years. On 9th July 1985 a new church hall was opened by the Bishop of Oxford.The hall is linked to the church by a covered walk which has been designed to blend in with the church architecturally.It is approximately 16m long and 6m wide and is a single stoney construction.The hall cost Â£52,000 to build and furnish and will be used for Sunday school meetings and other Church groups. The site of the new hall was a very old graveyard and it took many months to clear the ground ready for building.
